sub_concepts.name: Covalent Bonding
sub_concepts.definition: A type of chemical bond where two atoms share electrons to achieve stability.

sub_concepts.name: Ionic Bonding
sub_concepts.definition: A type of chemical bond where one atom donates an electron to another atom, resulting in two ions with opposite charges.

sub_concepts.name: Lewis Structures
sub_concepts.definition: A way of representing the valence electrons of an atom to predict the formation of molecular compounds.

sub_concepts.name: Formal Charge
sub_concepts.definition: A charge assigned to an atom in a molecule, calculated by taking the difference between the number of valence electrons of the atom and the number of electrons assigned to it in the Lewis structure.

sub_concepts.name: Resonance Structures
sub_concepts.definition: Multiple Lewis structures that describe the delocalization of electrons in a molecule, used when a single Lewis structure cannot accurately represent the electronic structure.

sub_concepts.name: Polarity
sub_concepts.definition: A property of a molecule that results from the uneven distribution of electron density, creating a dipole moment.

sub_concepts.name: Molecular Geometry
sub_concepts.definition: The three-dimensional arrangement of atoms in a molecule, determined by the shape of the electron pairs around the central atom.

sub_concepts.name: Valence Shell Electron Pair Repulsion (VSEPR) Theory
sub_concepts.definition: A model used to predict the shape of a molecule based on the repulsion of electron pairs in the valence shell of the central atom.
